p: Thus, there is a stochastic suppression of the spread; such extinctions are known to occur in ecological models due to demographic stochasticity that leads to a downward trend for small population sizes, as well as in biological models [ 46, 47]. Recurrences occur and are relatively stable for values of N greater than 4000, continuing up through 20,000 individuals as we have checked. See S4 Fig for sample runs from a population size of 20,000. It is computationally prohibitive to perform a large number of samples.
